info.description: The Student Curriculum service enables you to get information about student courses, course subjects and course sections.
info.title: studentCurriculum

tags.name: courseSections
tags.description: This resource returns all course sections or a collection of course subjects filtered by query parameters.

tags.name: courseSubjects
tags.description: This resource returns all course subjects or a collection of course subjects filtered by query parameters.

tags.name: courses
tags.description: This resource returns all courses or a collection of course subjects filtered by query parameters.

get.description: Retrieves a course with the specified ID. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of course sections.
get.description: Retrieves a collection of course sections. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

parameters.name: academicLevel
parameters.description: The academic level used by the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicLevels from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: academicPeriod
parameters.description: The starting academic period of the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicPeriods from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: course
parameters.description: The course for the course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /courses.

parameters.name: courseSubject
parameters.description: The subject for the course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /courseSubjects.

parameters.name: deliveryMode
parameters.description: The delivery mode for the course section.You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use the following values: Correspondence, Hybrid, In-Person, Online, Other Distance Mode.

parameters.name: instructionalFormat
parameters.description: The instructional format for the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use the following values: Clinical, Combination, Discussion, Experiential, Independent Study, Internship, Laboratory, Lecture, Recitation, Research, Seminar, Service Learning, Studio, Thesis, Workshop.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offeringAcademicUnit
parameters.description: The academic unit that offers this course section. You can specify multiple academicUnit query parameters using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: owningAcademicUnit
parameters.description: The academic unit that owns this course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: owningInstitutionalAcademicUnit
parameters.description: The institutional academic unit that owns this course section. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The section status of the course section. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use the following values: Preliminary, Open, Closed, Waitlist, Hold, Canceled.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single course section instance.
get.description: Retrieves a course section with the specified ID. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of courses. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

parameters.name: academicLevel
parameters.description: The academic level used by the courses. You can specify using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicLevels from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: academicUnit
parameters.description: The academic unit used by the course. You can specify multiple academicUnit query parameters using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: courseSubject
parameters.description: The subject for the course. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /courseSubjects.

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: The effective date of the Course's effective-dated fields: competencies, academicLevel, typicalPeriodsOffered, academicUnits, allowedLocations, owningInstitutionalAcademicUnit, tags, description, eligibilityRule, instructionalFormats, learningOutcomes, and title. Format for input is as such: YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: institutionalAcademicUnit
parameters.description: The institution academic unit used by the courses. You can specify by using the Workday ID or Reference ID. You can use a returned id from GET /academicUnits from studentAcademicFoundation service.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of course subjects. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

parameters.name: inactive
parameters.description: Indicates if a Course Subject is inactive.

parameters.name: institutionalAcademicUnit
parameters.description: The Institution Academic Units.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of course subjects. Secured by: Manage: Curriculum Management Scope: Student Records

parameters.name: ID

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

id.description: Workday Id or Reference Id of the instance.
